briefTitle: Study to Evaluate the EFFECTS of Acetylsalicylic Acid (ASA) on Niaspan®-Induced Flushing in Subjects With Dyslipidemia
officialTitle: Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Parallel, Acetylsalicylic Acid (ASA) Run-In Study to Evaluate the EFFECTS of Acetylsalicylic Acid on Niaspan®-Induced Flushing in Subjects With Dyslipidemia

arms.label: NER 500; ASA Pbo run-in, ASA coadmin
NER 500; ASA Pbo run-in, ASA Pbo coadmin
NER 1000; ASA Pbo run-in, ASA coadmin
NER 1000; ASA Pbo run-in, ASA Pbo coadmin

summary: The primary purpose of this study was to assess the effect of aspirin (ASA) on niacin extended-release (NER)-induced flushing in subjects with dyslipidemia.

primaryOutcome.measure: Maximum Severity of Flushing Events During Week 1 of Niacin Extended-release (NER) Treatment
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: From Baseline to end of Week 1
